subject: For your kind attention,
body:
For your kind attention,
My name is Dr Werner Wullschelger, the fund manager at Department of
Currency Management World Bank Switzerland.We received a telephone call
and email from Rev. Lawrence R. Larson, D.Th telling us to transfer your
fund of $10,700,000 through Atm MasterCard to his address via courier
service.
We want to know if you instructed Rev. Lawrence R. Larson, D.Th
permitting our corresponding bank to process and convert  your fund into
an Automated MasterCard(ATM) in favor of Rev. Lawrence R. Larson, D.Th.
Kindly keep up to date to avoid any wrong payment regarding the fund
transfer.We request you to kindly forward to us your valid telephone
number and contact address for further clarification.
We have decided to give you a CODE, THE CODE IS:206. Any time you
receive an email ,check if there is CODE (206) if the code is not
written,kindly delete the message from your box!
Best Wishes,
Dr Werner Wullschelger
(Fund Manager)
World Bank Switzerland

subject: Re:   For your kind attention,
body:
Dear Dr. Werner,

I am surprised to hear about this instruction from Rev. Lawrence R. Larson as I have not given him any authority to act on my behalf regarding this matter.

Please do not proceed with any transactions involving Rev. Larson and my fund. I would like to handle all matters related to my fund personally.

Here is my contact information:






Thank you for your understanding and cooperation in this matter.

Best wishes,
Patricia

subject: Re: For your kind attention,
body:
You ended up by providing no information, how do you expect us to regard
your message as a valid email response?

subject: Re: For your kind attention,
body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I apologize for the oversight in my previous email. I understand the importance of a proper signature for official correspondence.

Best Regards,
Lewis D.

Best wishes,
Patricia
